column1: GOT 'IM! He has sent his off-stump cartwheeling! Full length ball, and jags back in from just outside off stump, and Denly stretches to defend, but misses it altogeher. Denly goes for a golden duck, and Uthappa has to walk in virtually as an opener
length, outside off, and he presses forward to defend this towards point
length, outside off, and he comes forward to defend it. Looks for a single towards the gap between extra cover and point, but decides against it
length, outside off, and keeps a bit low, as it evades his outside edge. Bounces on its way through to Pant, and then Uthappa comes out to do a spot of gardening
length, jags back in, and strikes him on the pad as he shapes to play it straight back towards the bowler. Hits him quite high, and so Ishant thinks about an appeal, but decides against the review
length, outside off, moving further away, and beats the outside edge
full ball, but down towards leg stump, and Gill flicks this away towards long leg. Good shot
full ball, outside off, and he plays this towards cover. They go for a quick single, and make it
full ball, but again strays towards the pads, and Uthappa lifts this nonchalantly though midwicket
length, outside off, and he defends this
length, outside off, and he looks to push this towards covers, but gets an outside edge that takes it down towards third man
full ball, and Gill plays it away towards covers and sets off. A direct hit at the non-striker's end could have been interesting...but they miss anyway!
length, jags back in, and Gill has to defend this
length, outside off, and he cracks a drive towards cover, but cannot beat Prithvi Shaw there

shorter length ball, and he taps this towards mid on, and sets off. They just about make it, but good running in the end, as the man was quite deep at that position. Ooh, no, the replays suggest Gill would have been out had that hit
slower ball, on off stump, and he drives it back towards the bowler, who fields it. Delivered at just 122kph
length ball, cuts back into him, and goes off his pads towards third man
short, and he stands tall and whips this through midwicket. Well timed
length ball, cuts back into him, and he defends this towards short midwicket

slightly wider, and he throws his bat at this, and slices it over point. It gets height, and just about enough distance to carry for four. Made some room by backing away towards the legside. Smart shot
short ball, at his pads, and he clips this away towards square leg
full ball, at his pads, and he flicks this away. There's a man stationed at deep backward square leg, but that travelled like a rocket to his right
length, outside off, and he drives this towards cover
length, outside off, and he opens the face of the bat and just guides it down to third man. Super shot!
short, and outside off, and he swings this around towards deep midwicket. Easy shot in the end, as he picked the pace variation from Ishant, who was trying a slow leg-cutter
length, and he flicks this away towards square leg
full ball, on the pads, and he flicks this away. It's gone aerial, but far enough away from the man at fine leg
makes room for himself on the onside, and Ishant follows him with a short ball. He slaps it towards extra cover
length ball, towards his off stump, and he steps across and then whips it away towards long leg off the front foot
slower ball, on the pads, and he whips this away towards deep midwicket
length ball, at off stump, and he drives it back towards the bowler
fuller, at the stumps, and he drives it back towards the bowler
fuller ball, on off stump, and he drives this down to long off
fired towards the pads, and he flicks this towards square leg. Travels quickly to the man there
flat, towards the leg stump, and he defends this
length, and he pushes this away towards point
outside off, and he scoops this just over cover. Not far from the fielder there
full ball, and he drives this down towards long on. Oversteps in the process. Free-hit to follow
short, and he slaps this down towards long on. Didn't get a proper hold of it, but enough to send it 85m and 10 rows deep
length, outside off, and he dabs this towards extra cover and picks up a comfortable single
short, and he guides this towards third man. Exceptional timing, as it hurries away to the backward point region, beating third man for pace
full ball, and he drives this down towards long on
length ball, angles into him, and he flicks this towards midwicket
tossed up, on off stump, and he decides to defend this after pressing forward
tossed up around off stump, and he drives this down to long off
angles into him from wide of the crease, and he drives this towards long off
short, and he goes back and pulls this one towards long leg. That area is protected now, though
length, angles into him, and he punches this down towards deep midwicket
length, angles into him, and he backs away and punches it towards cover
length, and he punches this towards long on
fuller ball, and he drives it back down the wicket, and Rabada saves this with his right boot. It goes back towards Uthappa a long way. The two (bowler and batsman) share a bit of a smile
slower ball, looped up towards the blockhole, and Uthappa drives it back towards Rabada again
short, and he looks to hook this away, but gloves it up in the air, and Pant takes this diving away to his left. What a take from the keeper, and a good ball from Rabada to start it all!
length, angles across him, and he runs it down towards third man
short ball, angles into him, and he looks to run this towards third man, but cannot beat point
short ball, angles across him, and he runs this towards third man on the hop
full, outside off, and he drives this towards extra cover. The man at the fence has to run around to his right, and that gives them enough time to cross for two
slower ball, wide of off stump, and he slaps this towards deep cover point
angles a length ball across him, and he nudges it down towards third man
fuller ball, and he drives this down towards long on. The man there has to travel to his right and forward, and that allows them to touch down and come back for two. Excellent running
full, outside off, and he drives this towards long off
slower ball, full on the pads, misses the flick deceived by the slowness and it takes the pad on the way to the keeper
full and fast, down the leg side and called wide
strays onto the pads again, Gill clips it away to deep squareleg. Could have done more with that
full and wide outside off, throws his hands at it, times it well but finds deep cover
slower ball on middle, nice wristy flick earns him a single to long-on
short outside off, Rana comes down too hard on it rather than trying to time it and chops it back on the bounce to the keeper
length outside off, Rana has a slash and misses but it's called wide by the umpire. Was too wide
length outside off, tighter line, good carry, Rana has a tentative poke without getting across and close to the ball, is beaten on the outside edge
short on middle, rocks back and helps it along to deep midwicket but only for one
length outside off, cut away past point's left but deep cover does well to move swiftly to his right and keep it to one
breaks the shackles! Predictable length and line, Gill comes down the wicket, keeps his head still and launches down the ground for a massive six
length on off, pushed to long-off
tossed up outside off, Rana attempts the reverse sweep but misses
generously tossed up outside off again, Rana goes for an almighty heave but misses it completely
short outside off, Gill looks to cut it away and gets a thivck outside edge to third man to bring up a fifty. Excellent knock
length on middle, Rana looks to pull off the front foot but find midwicket in the circle
slower ball on the pads, Rana picks it up nicely, gets a lot of elevation and just clears the deep squareleg
Morris nails the yorker to silence the crowd! Rana gave himself room but Morris found the blockhole at pace to knock the stumps over
short one at the body, Russell ducks under it
attempted yorker, Russell tries to blast it over mid-off but only toe-ends it to the man
another excellent yorker and all Russell can do is squeeze it down to third-man
length on middle, pushed back to the bowler
length outside off, bit of width and Russell takes toll, cutting it hard past point and into the boundary
tossed up and angled in and Gill uses the angle to pick it up over deep midwicket for another six
fired in on the pads, Gill taps it on its head and it races away to the fine-leg fence. Axar under serious pressure and it's not even against Russell
length outside off, Gill shapes to go for another big one down the ground, doesn't get all of it but enough for a single to long-off
slower ball outside off, Gill adjusts his bat speed and cuts it late, bisecting point and short third-man

how unlucky is that? length on the pads, easy pickings he may have thought, timed it nicely as well but aerially and straight to short fine-leg, who was surprised by the pace at which it came at it him but held on comfortably in the end
full on the pads, whipped away to deep midwicket to get off the mark
follows him on a length as he makes room, but Russell shows he isn't all about power, uses his presence of mind and guides it down to fine-leg with the man up in the circle for an easy boundary
full on the pads, attempted yorker, clipped away to deep squareleg
length outside off, square driven by Karthik but straight to deep cover
full on the pads and clipped away straight to deep squareleg! It's another lucky break for the Capitals but they won't be complaining. He timed that so well that it comfortably carried to the man
length outside off and that's touch from Russell again, spotting the change in pace and bisecting point and short third-man

slower ball on middle, in the slot as Rabada misses the blockhole with the split-finger delivery and no more touch play from Russell, all power there as he launches it high and handsome into the stands over deep squareleg
yorker on middle, Russell squeezes it out to deep squareleg for one
full on the pads, clipped away to fine leg for one
full on off, opens the face and guides it to point for one
length on off, swats it hard along the ground to long-off
length on middle, pushed to mid-off for a quick single
the non striker is in trouble here! length on middle, hammered straight at Brathwaite, who has no time to react and is down on the ground
high full toss on middle, Russell clears his front leg and hammers it flat and hard over deep squereleg. Morris knew where that was headed as soon as it left his hand, wouldn't have had to look
length outside off, banged hard into the surface, doesn't get too high and Russell just pushes it to point off the backfoot and retains strike
short and angled in, Russell goes for the hook shot with his eyes not even on the ball but manages to clear the boundary with such consummate ease
Rabada's being taken apart here! Goes short again and Russell is ready, it's a pretty high bouncer but the power of the man carries it deep into the deep midwicket stand
full toss, follows him, single down to long-on. anticlimax
full on middle, pushed to long-on
another high full toss, Russell has an almighty heave, but for once he fails to make great connection and gets an inside edge back onto his body. That's hurt him
length on the pads, pushed towards midwicket for one

full toss outside off, Russell slashes and slashes hard but it goes flat and hard straight down third-man's throat. Hard to imagine that such a dismissal could be planned but the Capitals will be too relieved to think about such things
slower ball on middle, Chawla swings hard and early, gets an inside edges that beats his leg stump as well as the short fine-leg
yorker outside off, squeezes it out towards point and hands it over to Brathwaite
full outside off, drilled down to long-off for one
slower ball outside off, sliced away with his head falling away, but manages to clear point and retain strike with a single
full on off, Chawla goes big, doesn't time it, it goes high up in the air and hangs up there forever, two fielders were converging, in the end, nobody got there
length on middle, slower ball Brathwaite swings but the change in pace means he has to fetch it from well in front of his body, gets no power behind it and it's a simple catch down to deep midwicket
yorker outside off, and Chawla squeezes this away past point
slower ball on the pads, clipped away to deep squareleg's left but only for one
yorker outside off, Kuldeep goes across to tickle it fine but misses it completely
slower ball on a length, Kuldeep swings his bat in hope and gets a ood result as the leading edge lobs up safely over the keeper as they come across for two
short, angles in, and he flicks this away towards long leg
sharp, short, and tucks into him, and he plays this towards square leg
length, and he drives this a little in the air, but it lands short of point
short, and he hops and defends this with one hand. Good pace on that ball
short, and he comes forward and looks to slash this away, and it lands just short of the man at point
short, wide, and he cuts it hard into the ground towards extra cover
short, towards his body, and he takes his bottom hand off and fends this away towards square leg
shimmies across the stumps, and picks up a length ball at the stumps and flicks it away towards long leg
length, just outside off, and he gets up on his toes to punch this towards covers
fuller, wider, and he has absolutely laid into this one! Bent knee, and just smacks it square, and clears the fence
slower, fuller ball, and he watches it on to his feet and digs it out. Bowled at just 128kph
short ball, and he guides this around the corner, really fine, over where fine leg might have been
short, and he guides this over the slips, and gets it fast enough to go over third man. Top shot, which will do his confidence a world of good
advances down the pitch, Krishna throws it short and wide, and he slashes this over point. No fielder in the deep, and that means it's four on this really fast outfield

short, cuts back into him, and Karthik and the bowler go up in appeal for caught behind. It's been given not out, and they have reviewed this. The foot is fine, and it comes back into him, and bat and ball are quite close as the ball goes through after cutting him in half virtually. There's probably some part of the trouser that it has brushed, but has it also taken the bat or glove? This is a tricky one for the TV umpire Rod Tucker. Given not out
short, and wide, and he has given it the full monty. Slashed over backward point, and all the way for six!
fuller, outside off, and he clips this away towards backward point, where Robin Uthappa was moved to after the first two balls of this over

what a catch! Length ball angles in towards Shaw, and he gets the outside edge as Shaw looks to drive this from the crease, and it takes a big edge and flies away towards where first slip would have been. Karthik flies away to his right, and gets it within his mitts. Stupendous work, that should lift Kolkata Knight Riders after an expensive over from Prasidh Krishna!
short of a length, on off stump, and he cuts this, and Krishna lets it through, fielding at a short third man position
chance, but not taken! Russell hangs out a length ball, angles across Dhawan, and takes the outside edge as he pokes forward, and the man at a wide slip position, Nitish Rana, cannot hold on to it
short, wide, and he slaps this one hard, but cannot beat point
full ball, and he creams this one back past Russell towards long on. Mid on is up, and that was anyway hit straight enough
short, but no room for him, and he plays this away towards short third man from the crease
short ball, and he rocks back and hooks it off the front of his face towards long leg
short, and he dabs this straight down towards short cover and sets off for a quick single
short, and angles into him from wide of the crease, and beats his outside edge. Bowled at 145kph
length, angles into him, and he defends
full, and he drives this down the ground. Lazy, elegant, and beautiful
short, and he opens up as he looks to flick this. Takes the leading edge and runs towards mid off, and they pinch a single
short, and he hangs back and swings this away towards midwicket
short ball, and he chips it out towards point and takes a quick single. Well played by Iyer
length ball, straight towards off stump, and he is forced to defend this one
length, slower, as it angles across him, and he drives this towards backward point

short, and he flicks this away, and straight to Karthik. Iyer walks! It was down the leg side, and he literally would have taken a bit more bat to run it down to fine leg, possibly for four, but got a fine tickle on to it. Karthik takes his second catch with a good, swift movement to his left
short, and he ducks under this one. Thought about guiding it over slip for a while, but lets it go
short, straight, and he defends this
short, moving away from Dhawan, who cuts this towards backward point and will pick up two quite easily
tossed up, and he drives this past cover
short, and he goes back to cut it, but cannot beat point
flicks a length ball away towards midwicket
whips a fuller ball towards long on
cuts a length ball away towards backward point
angles it across him, and he goes back and punches this towards extra cover
another wrong 'un, just outside off, and he cuts it back towards deep backward point. They take on Brathwaite at that fence, and take two
fuller, angles across him, and he drops this with soft hands towards point, and they take another quick single
wrong 'un, and he goes back and cuts this past point

length, angles away, and he plays it with soft hands towards point. There's a direct hit from the fielder there, but they had started early, and the non-striker had made his ground safely at the striker's end
tossed up, and he slog-sweeps this to the right of deep midwicket. One-bounce four, and smart placement, as it bisects the fielders at long on and deep midwicket
short, and he rocks back and biffs this towards long on
length, and he goes back, but the ball chases him, and he plays it towards short cover
flighted, outside off, and he hits it hard, but cannot beat short cover
fuller, wider, and he cuts this away, but cannot beat point
fuller ball, turns away from him, and he goes back and punches it past short cover
tossed up, and he drives this down to long on
short, and he swivel-pulls it down towards long leg
short, and he whips this away off the backfoot, on one bounce through to the long leg fielder
short ball, but he comes down the wicket and flicks it down towards long leg. Played with soft hands, and so they turn back for the second
slower ball, outside off, and he has picked this one. Forces it through covers, and brings up fifty
short, and he whips this away towards fine leg. Beats short fine leg, and gets if fine enough to beat long leg. Uses the pace of the ball effectively
uses his feet to come down to a length ball, and flicks it to long leg
full on middle, down the wicket comes Dhawan, drills it down the ground but just for one
full and down the leg side, Pant unable to tap it on the head but it's a wide
down the wicket comes Pant, Kuldeep pushes it wider, deceives him in the air a little but Pant reaches it with one hand, which makes no difference as he clears long-off with ease
shorter on off, pushed through, Pant is ready for it and cuts it away for one
pushed through quicker and flatter on middle, Dhawan makes room and drives straight to cover
slower and outside off, Dhawan looks to cut and gets an outside edge to short third-man
quicker one from the front of the hand on middle, Dhawan goes down on one knee and sweeps it along the ground to deep squareleg
full outside off, pushed to long-off
length on middle, pant pushes it to long-on
length on the pads, clipped away between deep midwicket and deep squareleg and the call was for two immediately and they make it with ease
full outside off, almost a yorker as Dhawan came down the wicket, squeezes it out towards point for one
full on the pads, clipped away to deep squareleg
short on middle, pulled away to deep midwicket, all along the ground for one
full outside off and Dhawan drills it through the covers and races across the turf for four
compensates and goes shorter but still offers width, Dhawan punches it off the backfoot, past point for two
full on off, quick delivery, hits Dhawan on the splice as he pushes it to mid-off
length and angled in but way down the leg side
full on off, hands through the ball, piercing the cover field
full toss on the pads, clipped away nicely to deep squareleg for one
another full toss on middle, Pant flicks it away to deep squareleg's right but only for one
short outside off, Pant knows Chawla tends to bowl more googlies, bad line and hammered through the covers
another googly, slower, picked again, Pant rocks back and pulls it along the ground to long-on's left
googly on middle, hint of turn away, drilled straight to cover
quicker and flatter on the pads, scooped away towards deep squareleg for one
tossed up on middle, pushed to long-off
quicker on middle, Pant goes for the sweep again and nails it, along the ground, to the left of deep midwicket and into the boundary
length on middle, cramping Dhawan up a little, who pushes it back to the bowler
full outside off, overpitched and Dhawan hands through the ball again, beats the diving mid-off to his right and after that there is no stopping it
full and angled in, Dhawan makes room and pushes it to the cover region for one
length on middle, angled in, Pant has a swing, misses and gets one on the unmentionables. He looks winded. Break in play as he catches his breath
short outside off, pace and bounce, beats Dhawan as he tries to punch it with a straight bat rather than cut
full outside off, throws his hands at it and slices it past point for a couple
length on the pads, pushed towards midwicket with soft hands, they consider two but it isn't on
full and tossed up on middle, goes down for the sweep, hits it fine but straight to the man in the circle
short outside off, anticipating the charge, Pant rocks back and cuts it past point for one
full on off, down the wicket comes Dhawan and targets the short straight boundary, one bounce and off it goes
length outside off, steers it to short third-man to get into the 90s
full on the pads, Pant comes down the wicket and pushes it between long-on and deep midwicket for an easy couple. The Knight Riders appear pretty deflated
length on off, pace off the ball, pushed to long-off
full outside off, overpitched, asking to be driven and Pant obliges, blasting it through the covers
slower ball on middle and Pant has the license to go for the kill here, goes down on one knee and slogs it over deep midwicket for a maximum
short ball, hurries on a little, Pant pulls it along the ground to deep squareleg
short outside off, nice pace and bounce, Dhawan attempts an upper cut but misses
length outside off, leans back and pushes it past point for two
full on middle, Pant goes for another one-handed slog over long-on, doesn't get enough of it and is well taken right at the boundary. Played his role to near perfection, though
short outside off, cut away to deep point
fired into the pads, pushed back
length outside off, was shaping to scoop it but guides it to point as an afterthought and they scamper one
full on the pads, makes room and pats it on the off side with the fielders hanging on their heels and they complete another single
quicker one on middle, Ingram comes down the track and drills it to long-off and they take the fielder on, completing the two with ease in the end
googly outside off, steered to short third-man, Ingram calls Dhawan for the run, the throw comes in by he was past the keeper by the time it arrived
full outside off, Ingram tries to blast it through the off side, gets an outside edge which races to the fence
length on off, pushed to deep cover and that gives Dhawan a shot at his maiden IPL hundred
quicker one on the pads, Dhawan pushes it to deep squareleg for a single
full on middle and Ingram has launched this down the ground to finish the game in style and deny Dhawan the hundred
